p: This will require better protection and management of the natural resource base, tackling human and planetary health as joint objectives for the future development of food and land-use systems. Initial broad-level assessments suggest that reducing deforestation, improving monitoring, and other measures aimed at preventing the outbreak of a pandemic, would amount to 2% of the estimated cost of the COVID-19 pandemic over a 10-year timespan (Dobson et al., 2020).
